company.taskMan.project

Class Project

  • java.lang.Object
    • company.taskMan.project.Project
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Dependant
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DelegationProject

    public class Project
extends java.lang.Object
implements Dependant
    The project class used by TaskMan. A project will always have a name, a description, a creation time, a due time, a status and a list containing all tasks assigned to this project. A project has the responsibility to unwrap taskViews in order for the tasks to communicate with the system. A project will finish when all its tasks are finished or have a finished alternative (in order to finish, a project must have at least one task). A project can be either ongoing or finished.
    Author:
    Tim Van Den Broecke, Joran Van de Woestijne, Vincent Van Gestel and Eli Vangrieken

      • createTask

        public void createTask(java.lang.String description,
                       int estimatedDuration,
                       int acceptableDeviation,
                       ResourceManager resMan,
                       java.util.List<TaskView> prerequisiteTasks,
                       java.util.Map<ResourceView,java.lang.Integer> requiredResources,
                       TaskView alternativeFor,
                       java.lang.String taskStatus,
                       java.time.LocalDateTime startTime,
                       java.time.LocalDateTime endTime,
                       java.time.LocalDateTime plannedStartTime,
                       java.util.List<ResourceView> plannedDevelopers)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                       ResourceUnavailableException
        Creates a new Task with a status of failed or finished.
        Parameters:
        description - The description of the given Task.
        estimatedDuration - The estimated duration of the Task.
        acceptableDeviation - The acceptable deviation of the Task.
        resMan - | The resource manager
        prerequisiteTasks - The prerequisites Tasks for this Task.
        requiredResources - | The required resources for the Task.
        alternativeFor - The Task this new task will replace.
        taskStatus - The Status of the Task.
        startTime - The start time of the Task.
        endTime - The end time of the Task.
        plannedStartTime - | The planned start time of the Task
        plannedDevelopers - | The assigned developers of the Task
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - | If the supplied arguments are invalid
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - | If this method would result in an inconsistent system state
        ResourceUnavailableException - | If this method would result in an inconsistent system state

      • updateDependencyFinished

        public void updateDependencyFinished(Task preTask)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Updates the Dependency of the Project by providing a finished Task. The finished Task will be removed from the unfinished Task list and it's chain of alternatives as well. The Project will also check if it can set it's status to finished.
        Specified by:
        updateDependencyFinished in interface Dependant
        Parameters:
        preTask - | The prerequisite that has changed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - | if preTask isn't a Dependant

      • planTask

        public void planTask(TaskView task,
                     java.time.LocalDateTime plannedStartTime,
                     java.util.List<ResourceView> concRes,
                     java.util.List<ResourceView> devs)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                     ResourceUnavailableException
        Passes its arguments to the provided task (if it exists) and tries to plan it by invoking the plan(...) method on it.
        Parameters:
        task - | the task to plan
        plannedStartTime - | the planned start time for the task
        concRes - | the concrete resources to plan for the task
        devs - | the developers to plan for the task
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - | If the supplied arguments are invalid
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - | If this method would result in an inconsistent system state
        ResourceUnavailableException - | If the requested resource is unavailable for reservation

      • planRawTask

        public void planRawTask(TaskView task,
                        java.time.LocalDateTime plannedStartTime,
                        java.util.List<ResourceView> concRes,
                        java.util.List<ResourceView> devs)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                        ResourceUnavailableException
        Passes its arguments to the provided task (if it exists) and tries to plan it by invoking the rawPlan(...) method on it. It is however possible that this planning will conflict with other plannings in the system. It is the responsibility of the user when applying this method to check for conflicts using the findConflictingPlannings and handle these conflicts appropriately. If you want to be sure to not get into an inconsistent state, use planTask instead.
        Parameters:
        task - | the task to plan
        plannedStartTime - | the planned start time for the task
        concRes - | the concrete resources to plan for the task
        devs - | the developers to plan for the task
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - | If the supplied arguments are invalid
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - | If this method would result in an inconsistent system state
        ResourceUnavailableException - | If the requested resoruce isn't available for reservation

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        A method to check whether this project is finished
        Returns:
        True if and only if this project is finished

      • getEstimatedEndTime

        public java.time.LocalDateTime getEstimatedEndTime(java.time.LocalDateTime currentTime)
        Calculate the estimated end time of the project, depending on the task that has the longest delay chain. If no tasks are currently available it will return the current Time.
        Parameters:
        currentTime - | The current time to use as an offset
        Returns:
        The estimated end date of the project. Will always be

      • reserve

        public boolean reserve(ResourceView resource,
                       TaskView task,
                       java.time.LocalDateTime startTime,
                       java.time.LocalDateTime endTime)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       ResourceUnavailableException,
                       java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Reserve a resource for a task from a given start time to a given end time
        Parameters:
        resource - | The resource to reserve
        task - | The reserving task
        startTime - | The start time of the new reservation
        endTime - | The end time of the new reservation
        Returns:
        True if the resource was reserved by the given task, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - | If the supplied arguments are invalid
        ResourceUnavailableException - | If the requested resource isn't available for reservation
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - | If this method would result in an inconsistent system state

      • getMaxDelayChain

        public TimeSpan getMaxDelayChain()
        Answers the question from tasks of how much delay this Dependant adds to the total time chain it is investigating. Always returns a TimeSpan object with length 0.
        Specified by:
        getMaxDelayChain in interface Dependant
        Returns:
        | a TimeSpam with length 0

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public java.util.Optional<BranchView> getResponsibleBranch(BranchRepresentative branchRep,
                                                           TaskView task)
        Determine whether or not the taskview contains a task belonging to this project, if so, the branch representative will be queried for the possible presence of a responsible branch for the given task.
        Parameters:
        branchRep - | The representative of the branch this project belongs to
        task - | A task to get the responsible branch for
        Returns:
        The branch responsible for the given task if present
